paper.title: Pinwheel scheduling: Achievable densities

author.org: Information Sciences Research, AT&T Labs - Research, 180 Park Avenue, Florham Park, NJ 07932, USA. fish@research.att.com, jcl@research.att.com., US

paper.abstract: A pinwheel schedule for a vector v= (v 1 , v 2 , . . ., v n ) of positive integers 2 ≤ v 1 ≤ v 2 ≤ ⋅s ≤ v n is an infinite symbol sequence {S j : j ∈ Z} with each symbol drawn from [n] = {1,2, . . ., n } such that each i ∈ [n] occurs at least once in every v i consecutive terms (S j+1 , S j+2 , . ., S j+vi ) . The density of v is d(v) = 1/v 1 + 1/v 2 + ⋅s + 1/v n . If v has a pinwheel schedule, it is schedulable . It is known that v(2,3,m) with m ≥ 6 and density d(v) = 5/6 + 1/m is unschedulable, and Chan and Chin [2] conjecture that every v with d(v) ≤ 5/6 is schedulable. They prove also that every v with d(v) ≤ 7/10 is schedulable.
